kunyomiList.definition: butt　(usually given the honorable 'o', like so：おしり SARC1/2 KANA

kunyomiList.definition: tail (BOOBOO: most people say 尻尾）

kunyomiList.definition: a) the wonderful mother/child bond that teaches Japanese kindness and benevolence, b) the mother-child bond that forever stunts the hustle and self-reliance and independence of many Japanese. CCWKANA
usually means sweet-tasting - but ALSO means 'not spicy.' (Q; Is it karai? A; no, daijoubu, it's quite amai.)

jukugoList.components: 甘 (sweet) + 見 (look) = 甘く見る (not take seriously)

kunyomiList.definition: ：a certain　ｘｘｘ　; it also has the connotation of 'undisclosed', like Dick Cheny's undisclosed location.
to plot a murder! Murder most faoouuullll!!! almost never used.

jukugoList.components: 無 (without) + 謀 (plot) = 無謀 (unpremeditated)
陰 (shady) + 謀 (plot) = 陰謀 (conspiracy )

kunyomiList.hiragana: ( が or に ) み＊える
kunyomiList.definition: be able to see. As in, "Can you see that bird in the distance?"
to show off. This is not an offensive term - you can even say it about yourself, "I'd like to show off my new boyfriend!"

jukugoList.components: 意 (meaning) + 見 (look) = 意見 (opinion)
見 (look) + 付 (stick to) = 見付ける (find)
花 (flower) + 見 (look) = 花見 (sakura-viewing party)
寛 (leniency) + 大 (big) = 寛大 (lenient)
寛 (leniency) + 容 (appearance) = 寛容 (tolerance, leniency )

kunyomiList.definition: I roast food, (but sometimes used with other stuff, like 'I burn the flag' or even CD-burning)

jukugoList.components: 日 (sun, day) + 焼 (roast / grill) = 日焼け (sunburn)
焼 (roast / grill) + 鳥 (bird) = 焼鳥 (roast chicken)
焼 (roast / grill) + 肉 (meat) = 焼肉 (roast meat, usually beef.)
夕 (evening) + 焼 (roast / grill) = 夕焼け (sunset)

kunyomiList.definition: boundary - can be used with countries OR property lines of 2 pieces of land. Usually used when talking about crossing a boundary, or being within the boundary.

jukugoList.components: 環 (environment) + 境 (border) = 環境 (environment)
国 (country) + 境 (border) = 国境 (national border)
境 (border) + 界 (the world) = 境界 (boundary)

kunyomiList.definition: to display something, to make something manifest.
something appears - symptoms, your soul-mate, attackers, rappers that bite my style crop up all over the place since I blew up.

現 (present time) + 実 (truth) = 現実 (reality)

kunyomiList.definition: older brother (used about ANYONE's older brother, or even ANY guy that strikes you as being of an 'older brother' age, almost like you could substitute niisan for 'dude')
older brother (used about YOUR own personal brother)

不 (un) + 況 (condition) = 不況 (recession)

kunyomiList.definition: competing to get the best grade, the most sales. 90% overlapping with 競争; same useage and everything. fugeddaboutit.

kunyomiList.definition: moral outrage - at corruption, murder, etc. It doesn't have to be expressed by yelling, though. It can be hidden inside.

jukugoList.components: 憤 (get indignant) + 慨 (deplore) = 憤慨 (resentment, burning slow anger.)

kunyomiList.definition: spew- not vomit, but like lava, fire or high-pressure water. (vomit is 吐く　（はく））

jukugoList.components: 貨 (cargo) + 物 (animal / thing) = 貨物 (cargo, freight)

kunyomiList.definition: scanty, skimpy, meager.Mostly used about　amounts of money.

kunyomiList.definition: bet/risk (not just money, but also situations like 'She's betting her reputation that her scence theory will disprove Stephen Hawking')
quality, as in しつがいい、or しつ が わるい (the quality is good / bad).

something is piled up、something has accumulated

kunyomiList.definition: value - but not an actual dollar amount (that'd be 値段） . 価 is value as in, ('the value of the antique goes up with time' or 'I'll estimate the value, using my jewler's loupe and tweezers.')

the one key point, the lynchpin of

the door is shut or closed。 Also, the Man cracks down on something, tightens controls on something.
I shut (a book, my eyes, my heart... those are the only times you use it!)
the book / eyes/ mouth gets shut.A store shuts down, goes out of business.

kunyomiList.definition: kind of formal word for husband NP

BOOBOO: this is usually translated as nest, but anywhere an animal lives is a SU. A spider's web, a badger's burrow, are all 巣.
